definition: Qinqiang, an opera style popular in northwest China, possibly originating in Ming dynasty folk music/Shaanxi opera
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]
cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech

sentences.english: Jia's Shaanxi Opera expresses a hopeless spiritual return to the hometown.
sentences.chinese: 賈平凹的《秦腔》正表達了這種無望的精神回鄉。

sentences.english: Shanxi Opera is the typical text of revealing his hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 《秦腔》是揭示他的躑躅的典型文本。

sentences.english: The Shaanxi Opera is also a blow to the Evolution cavity.
sentences.chinese: 現在的秦腔也是吹腔衍變來的。

sentences.english: Qin Opera feature is mainly the language from the Shaanxi opera style of decision.
sentences.chinese: 秦腔的特色主要是由秦腔的語言風格決定的。

definition: a general term for local operas in Shangxi, Henan, Hebei, Shandong etc/the music of such operas
genre of song-and-dance duet popular in Inner Mongolia
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
Kunqu opera, influential musical theater originating in Kunshan, Jiangsu province in Yuan times
